steps.description: Customer registers for an HL account, providing email, password, and initial personal details.
steps.businessRationale: Registration is typically fast but must include secure validation. A smooth experience increases onboarding conversion and reduces abandonment.

steps.description: Customer completes KYC/AML checks using document verification and personal data validation.
steps.businessRationale: KYC is mandatory for regulated investment platforms. Automated checks typically take 5â€“10 minutes depending on provider response times.

steps.description: HL creates the investment account (ISA, SIPP, or General Investment Account) and links it to the user profile.
steps.businessRationale: Account provisioning involves backend orchestration, eligibility checks, and account number assignment.

steps.description: Customer deposits funds via debit card or bank transfer to enable first investment.
steps.businessRationale: Funding is a revenue-critical step. Payment provider latency and bank authentication influence duration.

steps.description: Customer selects a fund and executes their first investment order.
steps.businessRationale: Fund purchase involves price retrieval, order validation, and execution routing. This step directly generates trading fees and future AUM-based revenue.

steps.description: Customer reviews holdings, configures recurring investments, and sets portfolio preferences.
steps.businessRationale: Portfolio setup increases long-term retention and recurring investment revenue. UX clarity is essential to reduce drop-off.
